sn3.12:4.2: Now at that time five kings headed by Pasenadi were amusing themselves, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation, and this discussion came up among them:
sn3.12:4.5: “Sights are the best of sensual pleasures!”
sn3.12:4.14: Since those kings were unable to convince each other,
sn3.12:5.2: “Come, good sirs, let’s go to the Buddha
sn3.12:5.4: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
sn3.12:6.1: Then those five kings headed by Pasenadi went to the Buddha,
sn3.12:6.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
sn3.12:6.3: King Pasenadi reported their conversation to the Buddha, and said:
sn3.12:6.16: Sir, what’s the best of sensual pleasures?”
sn3.12:7.1: “Great King, which kind of sensual stimulation is best is defined by which is most agreeable, I say.
sn3.12:7.2: The very same sights that are agreeable to some are disagreeable to others.
sn3.12:7.3: When you’re happy with certain sights, as you’ve got what they wished for, you don’t want any other sight that’s better or superior.
sn3.12:7.4: For you, those sights are perfect

sn3.12:12.1: Now at that time the lay follower Candanaṅgalika was sitting in that assembly.
sn3.12:12.2: Then he got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha, and said:
sn3.12:12.3: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
sn3.12:12.4: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
sn3.12:13.1: Then the lay follower Candanaṅgalika extolled the Buddha in his presence with an appropriate verse.

sn3.12:15.1: Then those five kings presented Candanaṅgalika with five upper robes.
sn3.12:15.2: And Candanaṅgalika presented them all to the Buddha.
